availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: N. B. Earle (Hopkins co, KY, farmer )

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Miriam C. Reece Earle in Trigg County, Kentucky, on July 11, 1850. Father of Josephine R. Earle. Resident in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1860. Employed J. R. Teague as a farm laborer in Hopkins County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 89B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 606.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 210A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Trigg County Marriages, Film #000321335, p. 134.
"N. B. Earle (1823-1865)," Find A Grave, Memorial #91532749, accessed March 9, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/91532749.
